modName: Key mapping hex codes for reference
summary: It\'s simply the \"hex codes\" that correspond to keys...
descriptionHtml:
It\'s simply the \"hex codes\" that correspond to keys...

SEE BELOW (FAR BELOW!!) for the hex codes...

By utilizing these codes, you can go in and change what keys are bound to what.

Some clarification there... you need to edit under the folder:
C:/Users/[[YOUR NAME/COMP]]/Documents/My Games/Skyrim

And edit the file:
controlmap.txt

NOTE: To use the keypad/numpad, you ** MUST CHANGE SOME FLAGS TO \"1\" ** (instead of their default of \"0\") in order to tell the Skyrim engine that you\'d like to re-map the numpad to your own liking.

Look in the \"controlmap.txt\" file.  It will tell you which flags do what.  :)  In general, you will likely be changing the FIFTH flag.

Also... keep in mind, the current version of Skyrim (as of 11-22) will NOT update what keys are what IN-GAME.  That is to say... Skyrim will likely still say junk like:

\"Press E to _____ and R to _______\"

...even if you\'ve re-mapped the function of \"E\" & \"R\" to other keys!  To be more clear... if you mapped \"ALT\" to what used to be Skyrim\'s default of \"E\"... umm... sorry--it\'s still going to read \"E\" in game.  Frustrating.

Apparently, some modder said they fixed that, but... I was unable to get it to work properly. 




Credit to Crazy-G, where I got the idea from via his \"Interface Hard Coded Key Tweaks\" (by crazy-g).

http://www.skyrimnexus.com/downloads/file.php?id=88
